hedline.hl1: On Essex County As Literary Inspiration

abstract.p: Bette Hanauer letter on September 17 article on writers from Essex County (NJ) recalls work of Cathi Hanauer (S)

block.p: I was especially interested in the cover article on literary inspiration from Essex County ''Look Homeward'' (Sept. 17). One writer not mentioned is Cathi Hanauer, author of ''My Sister's Bones,'' (Delacorte) a novel set in the fictitious Essex County town of West Berry. Using the cultural background of the Newark suburbs, the book tells the story of a young woman's struggles to save her older sister from anorexia while dealing with her own issues of growing up. It is studied in contemporary women's literature courses at many colleges including the University of Virginia.
